alert.note: Alert for Pierce; Skagit (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 04 at 4:11AM PDT until November 05 at 2:14PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Washington and west central Washington, including the following counties, in northwest Washington, Clallam, Grays Harbor, Jefferson, Skagit and Whatcom. In west central Washington, King, Lewis, Pierce, Snohomish and Thurston. * WHEN...Through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A potent weather system will bring heavy rainfall to the region today through early Saturday. This rainfall will result in rapid rises and potential for flooding along area rivers. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
